comments: The value of this continued fraction is the ratio of two Bessel functions: BesselI(0,2)/BesselI(1,2) = A070910/A096789. Or, equivalently, to the ratio of the sums: sum_{n=0..inf} 1/(n!n!) and sum_{n=0..inf} n/(n!n!). - Mark Hudson (mrmarkhudson(AT)hotmail.com), Jan 31 20031.43312...=[1,2,3,4,5,...] = shape of a rectangle which partitions into n squares at stage n; i.e. this is an example of the match between the continued fraction of a number r and a rectangle having shape r.  See A188640. - _Clark Kimberling_, Apr 09 2011
maple: A060997:=proc(q) local a,n; a:=n+1;for n from q by -1 to 1 do a:=1/a+n; od; print(evalf(a,100)); end:A060997(10^5); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Mar 28 2013
mathematica: RealDigits[ FromContinuedFraction[ Range[ 44]], 10, 110] [[1]](* Or *) RealDigits[ BesselI[0, 2] / BesselI[1, 2], 10, 110] [[1]](* Or *) RealDigits[ Sum[1/(n!n!), {n, 0, Infinity}] / Sum[n/(n!n!), {n, 0, Infinity}], 10, 110] [[1]]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 14 2001
